# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

This project is a personal portfolio website. Security updates are applied to the latest version only.

| Version  | Supported          |
| -------- | ------------------ |
| Latest   | :white_check_mark: |
| < Latest | :x:                |

## Reporting a Vulnerability

If you discover a security vulnerability in this project, please report it responsibly:

### How to Report

1. **Email**: Send details to [hello@k0r37k1.dev](mailto:hello@k0r37k1.dev)
2. **GitHub Security Advisory**: Use [GitHub's private vulnerability reporting](https://github.com/k0r37k1/k0r37k1.dev/security/advisories/new)

### What to Include

- Description of the vulnerability
- Steps to reproduce
- Potential impact
- Suggested fix (if any)

### Response Timeline

- **Acknowledgment**: Within 48 hours
- **Initial Assessment**: Within 1 week
- **Fix & Disclosure**: Coordinated with reporter

### Security Best Practices

This project follows these security practices:

- âœ… No hardcoded secrets or API keys
- âœ… Environment variables via `.env` (gitignored)
- âœ… Dependabot for dependency updates
- âœ… Regular security audits
- âœ… HTTPS-only deployment
- âœ… CSP headers configured

## Disclosure Policy

- Vulnerabilities will be disclosed publicly after a fix is available
- Credit will be given to the reporter (unless anonymity is requested)
- Critical vulnerabilities will be patched within 7 days

## Out of Scope

The following are considered out of scope:

- Issues in third-party dependencies (report to the dependency maintainer)
- Social engineering attacks
- Physical attacks
- Denial of Service (DoS) attacks

Thank you for helping keep this project secure! ðŸ”’
